name: Cadillac Ranch
description: An art installation featuring ten half-buried Cadillac cars, nose-down in the dirt, encouraging graffiti.

name: The World's Largest Ball of Twine (made by one man)
description: A massive ball of sisal twine rolled by Francis A. Johnson over 29 years.

name: Carhenge
description: A replica of England's Stonehenge constructed from vintage American cars.

name: Wall Drug Store
description: Famous for offering free ice water, now a sprawling complex with shops, eateries, and quirky attractions including a giant dinosaur.

name: Salvation Mountain
description: A large-scale folk art installation created by Leonard Knight, made of adobe, straw, and thousands of gallons of paint.

name: Lucy the Elephant
description: A six-story elephant-shaped building constructed in 1881, now a National Historic Landmark.

name: Hole N' The Rock
description: A 5,000 square foot home carved out of a massive sandstone rock formation.

name: The Fremont Troll
description: A colossal sculpture of a troll crushing a Volkswagen Beetle, located under the George Washington Memorial Bridge.

name: Prada Marfa
description: A permanently installed sculpture resembling a Prada store, located in the middle of the desert.

name: World's Largest Ketchup Bottle
description: A 170-foot tall water tower designed to look like a Brooks Ketchup bottle.

name: Cabazon Dinosaurs
description: Two giant dinosaur sculptures, 'Dinny' the Brontosaurus and 'Mr. Rex' the T-Rex.

name: South of the Border
description: A sprawling tourist complex with a Mexican theme, featuring shops, restaurants, amusement rides, and a giant sombrero tower.

name: Foamhenge
description: A full-size replica of Stonehenge made entirely out of styrofoam. Currently located at Cox Farms.

name: Enchanted Highway
description: A 32-mile stretch of highway featuring several massive scrap metal sculptures.

name: The Blue Whale of Catoosa
description: A large, smiling blue whale structure built on a pond, originally as an anniversary gift.

name: Corn Palace
description: A multi-purpose arena decorated annually with murals and designs made from corn and other grains.

name: Big Texan Steak Ranch
description: Home of the free 72 oz. steak challenge (if eaten in under an hour). Features a motel and kitschy decor.

name: Weeki Wachee Springs State Park
description: Famous for its underwater mermaid shows in a natural spring.

name: Desert of Maine
description: A 40-acre expanse of glacial silt resembling a desert, incongruously located in Maine.

name: Bishop Castle
description: An elaborate, ornate stone and iron castle built single-handedly by Jim Bishop over decades.

name: The Thing?
description: A mysterious roadside attraction advertised for miles with billboards asking 'What is The Thing?'. Housed in a dedicated museum.

name: World's Largest Pistachio
description: A 30-foot tall sculpture dedicated to the founder of McGinn's Pistachio Tree Ranch.

name: Dog Bark Park Inn
description: A bed & breakfast inn shaped like a giant beagle named Sweet Willy.

name: Dinosaur Land
description: A park filled with over 50 large fiberglass dinosaur models.

name: Ave Maria Grotto
description: Features 125 miniature replicas of famous religious structures and landmarks, built by a Benedictine monk.
